content.description: From a sit start climb the overhang reaching for holds on both sides of the arete until you get to the jug holds at the top.
content.protection: 2 pads (need to be able to make landing flat)
content.location: The far right hand side of Indian Cave. An Overhang which is above a bad, very uneven, landing.

content.description: Start in the cave on 2 good slopers and a left heel hook. Match an undercling and bring your feet up to the 2 starting holds. Reach for the lip of the cave to a slopey pinch with your right hand and heel hook the lip with your right foot. Bring your left hand to the lip of the cave to another slopey pinch and then reach again for another good sloper. Finish with a mantle.
content.protection: 1-2 bouldering mats with spotter/someone to move pads, 2-3 pads when you're by yourself
content.location: When entering via the North end the park where Shorakkopock Rock is take a left, walk about 500 feet and then take a right up the final dirt path which leads up to the caves (fourth dirt path up to the right in all, the first one doesn't lead to the caves). Walk straight up the path and the first boulder you come to on the path is Indian Cave

content.description: Start on the left hand side of the obvious feature halfway into the cave. From there reach up to a good, but hard to hold edge which is slanting to the left. Next Dyno to the lip or use fancy footwork. Then do a difficult mantle to finish.
content.protection: 1-2 pads with spotter/someone to move the pads 2-3 pads if you're by yourself.
content.location: When entering via the North end the park where Shorakkopock Rock is take a left, walk about 500 feet and then take a right up the final dirt path which leads up to the caves (fourth dirt path up to the right in all, the first one doesn't lead to the caves). Walk straight up the path and the first boulder you come to on the path is Indian Cave

content.description: The namesake to this area. An obvious cave, featuring a few high quality climbs.
